oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oath of allegiance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This oath of allegiance to the United States is pasted on Trousdale County Court Clerk letterhead. The paper--proof of loyalty--was issued to [illegible] and signed by [?] C. Smith and J. S. Bonham. For most Confederate soldiers and citizens, signing the oath was a bitter pill. The Oath of Allegiance was adhered to the letterhead post-Civil War as Trousdale County did not exist until 1870.
